entry.title: You Learn Something New Every Day â€“ Romanian
entry.content: Romanian is a latin-based language, like French. “Thank-you” in Romanian? “Merci”.

entry.title: You Learn Something New Every Day - MATLAB
entry.content: For such an intelligent (and extremely expensive) program, MATLAB can be pretty dumb.

entry.title: You Learn Something New Every Day - Bicycle Maintenance
entry.content: There is, in fact, a sort of “critical mass” of how many zip ties can be used to fix a bike until it is necessary to actually do repairs. By my best estimations, this critical mass is somewhere around 25% of the weight of the bike.

entry.title: You Learn Something New Every Day - Frying Potatoes
entry.content: When you want to cook potatoes, don’t try to fry them. Even small ones. And definitely don’t start frying them at the same time as onions, sausages, hashbrowns and peas. It just… doesn’t work.

entry.title: You Learn Something New Every Day - Sideways Snow
entry.content: Today I learned that it is fully possible for snow to fall within a few degrees of horizontal. Additionally, if you are cycling, the wind that causes this odd snow behaviour is guaranteed to be in your face.
